author: sky.cactus
content: Coinbase wallet app now lists `Ethereum 2` as an independent asset under the `ETH2` ticker! (╯°□°）╯︵ ┻━┻

author: sky.cactus
content: I cannot express enough urgency at dropping the "ETH2" and "Ethereum 2" from everything we do.

author: sky.cactus
content: Also, would be great if someone could reach out to Coinbase and explain to them that there is no ETH2, there will be no ETH2, and calling an asset ETH2 is going to lead to a huge number of users getting scammed.

author: benjaminion
content: It's been the case for the last three years that we've been using the Eth2 name that there would not be a (genuinely) distinct Eth2 asset. We didn't worry overly about scammers during that time, so I'm not sure why the panic now. Nothing much has changed on that front imo.

author: sky.cactus
content: Its not new, I have been lobbying to drop the "eth2" naming convention for quite a while.  This is just the first time I have seen ETH2 used such wrong and misleading way from such a visible company, and in a way that aligns with exactly what I have been shouting was going to happen (much like Chicken Little).

author: pietjepuk
content: Kraken uses ETH2 as well by the way, and has for a while. I think the problem will resolve itself eventually with the merge, but it is very misleading indeed. In this age of the internet I don't think telling them to stop using ETH2 will work, but maybe an army of noobs asking them to also list some fancy "ETH3" token will

author: sky.cactus
content: Step 1: **WE** need to stop using the ETH2 terminology.

author: sky.cactus
content: Nothing positive will happen as long as we continue to have channels name eth2, meetings named eth2, websites named eth2, etc.

author: sky.cactus
content: Once we stop calling it that, *then* we can start lobbying others to stop calling it that and hope for some success.  That being said, it would be good if we could at least get a couple of the big names like Coinbase and Kraken to stop sooner rather than later, but I find the chances of that to be low as long as <https://launchpad.ethereum.org/> still is called "Eth2 Launchpad".

author: sky.cactus
content:
1. There is no "Ethereum 2" nor "Ethereum 2.0".  It was a meme to indicate a series of big upgrades, but there will not be some point in time where we are "now on Ethereum 2.
2. There is no ETH2 asset.
3. When the devs all talk about ETH2, end-users don't realize/understand (1) or (2).
4. Scammers can leverage this miscommunication to great effect, for example by creating an ETH2 token, ETH2 blockchain, or just fishing.

author: sky.cactus
content: The problem is that the core devs/EF are propagating a misconception that will result in user confusion, and leveraging user confusion is where scammers do really well.
